alert.note: Alert for Benewah (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 12:32PM MDT until May 11 at 8:09AM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Idaho... St Joe River at St Maries affecting Benewah County. For the St. Joe River...including Calder, St Maries...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St Joe River at St Maries. * WHEN...From this afternoon to Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 33.0 feet, Water may be over St Joe City Road, east of St. Maries to Calder. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM PDT Friday the stage was 32.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 31.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this afternoon to 33.3 feet late Sunday morning. It will then fall late Tuesday morning. It will rise to 32.7 feet late Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 32.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 33.5 feet on 02/20/1995. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1145 PM PDT.
